intro: Ramosmania heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf ramosmania, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually glossy and have a distinct aromatic scent, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
